abstractive.text: The thesis proposal, on the other hand, presents the idea of "construal" and makes claims as to how inferences are drawn in a probabilistic relational model by using information from the ontology, situation, user and discourse models.

extractive.speaker: C
extractive.text: and then it continues to say that one could potentially build a probabilistic relational model that has some general , domain - general rules

extractive.text: and then the idea is to use ontology , situation , user , and discourse model to instantiate elements in the classes of the probabilistic relational model <pause> to do some inferences in terms of what is being construed as what
extractive.label: s
